inn1.comm: and a good start from Collymore, cutting this back into de Villiers who initially looks for a run, but Collymore leaps to his right to field
again well bowled, just short of a length and de Villiers is back into his crease, flicking it with elastic wrists...but again he can't break the midwicket gap
wider of the off stump this time and it's left alone. A touch of outswing there for Collymore
down the leg side. And wided
oh dear. The radar's battery juice is running out again. This one is wide of the off stump and called as such
again drifting down leg and it's turned off his pads for a single
and Smith goes for a chumping cut but can't time it and it bobbles out into the off side
down the leg side, off his pads and Smith steals the strike
and he starts with a cracking delivery, a firey lifter which passes by Smith's wafty push outside his off stump. Terrific first ball
ooh and some swing for Powell straight away, too; on leg stump, swinging into his pads. Smith tries to push it to leg but rather falls over, as is his wont, and Powell roars an optimistic appeal
quick again, and Smith gets bat on it this time, nudging it out into the off side - without great conviction
again Smith is hurried into a stroke, and it's too full to be pulling - but Smith does pull, without timing or conviction and it bobbles out pathetically to midwicket
his first poor ball, too wide - swinging wider of the off stump and de Villiers leaves alone
and another wide. That was possibly a Test wide, in fact, if not a Harmison-wide
beautiful ball, in the channel - in the corridor, if you like - and left alone.
oh dear - that's just rubbish. Down Smith's leg side and rightly called a wide
poked off the back foot behind square. Ugly stroke, if reasonably effective. Effective in that he got a run for it
shot. A gift from the bowler, too short and wide, but it was sweetly struck off the back foot, well in front of square for four
and a good line this time from Collymore, just outside de Villiers' off stump who is watchful in his arm-shouldering antics
less watchful this time, deliberately cutting this - slicing it, rather - down to third man
Smith's bread and butter, there, just nudging one to leg and scampering through for a single
good line and length outside off. de Villiers leaves it alone, and well done him
good one on off stump, forcing Smith back who plays it into the covers off the back foot

terrific ball; just outside off stump, swinging into him and Smith's concrete-feet are trapped in the crease as he tries to clamp down on it at the very last minute but gets an inside edge. That was mighty close, mighty mighty close
Smith is right back into his crease, almost eating the stumps, defending this solidly off the back foot
and that'll be four - no it won't, but it should've been. Smith cutting with ferocity, but without the placement
well that's just a daft stroke from de Villiers, attempting to cover-drive a Powell outswinger and missing it entirely
left alone outside off
on off stump and Smith is back, defending it with a high front elbow
a very ugly stroke, Smith not moving his feet as he tries to clatter it through the covers
well bowled, swinging it into the right hander who is struck on the pads trying to work it to leg
excellent ball, cutting away from Smith but, to his credit, he read it well and left alone. Too short to be driving, mind, which probably helped him in his decision
neatly clipped on his legs through the covers but Lara is quick beyond his years, preventing two
de Villiers walks into this defensive stroke, presenting the full face of the moon, and the bat, to the bowler
and again excellent swing for Powell (if a swinging ball can be excellent), with this one swinging across the left hander who again is troubled by it, defending it off the back foot
but that's Smith's bread and butter, on his leg stump and he turns it away down to fine leg. A fumble from Bradshaw isn't costly
impressive pace from Powell, de Villiers almost steps to leg in leaving that one alone
classily driven on the front foot to cover
very well timed from Smith, pumping it almost one-footed to midwicket
punched to mid-off
good line, nagging length and de Villiers watches it zoot past him. Afterwards, a nervous Alec-Stewart-like jig rather suggests he wants to get on with things
better still from Collymore here, on middle stump and it's pushed to mid-on

ooh, not at all convincing from de Villiers. A terrific line from Collymore who's made up for his first-over-shocka, as the batsman pushes this one off the back foot - getting on top of the bounce well, but pushing it away from his body
very well bowled once again, this one angling into de Villiers who shapes to drive but gets a very ugly, thick inside edge
on off stump, and pushed back to the bowler
oh dear, oh dear, oh dear. That is a terrible stroke. Half a step down the track, trying to hit an outswinger over the top and a thick edge hands the wicketkeeper the simplest of catches
defended on the front foot
good, quick ball outside off stump which is angled, without moving his feet, to point
well bowled! A fine yorker, spearing into to Kallis's leg stump who digs it out
again spearing into his leg stump but fuller in length, and Kallis works it through midwicket for a couple
another fine delivery, almost squaring up Kallis who plays it with one hand off the bat, angling it down into the off side
slightly too leg-side-drifty and it's worked through midwicket
just short of a length, it's pushed out to cover
right on the money - attacking off stump, and Kallis is hunched in defence. That one kept just a touch low
and again a terrific line here, an inch or so outside Kallis's off stump who again is quite crouched in defending it on the front foot
straighter from Collymore this time, but Kallis can't beat midwicket
pushed off the back foot into the covers for the fourth dot of the over
a good end to another fine over, Kallis just punching it defensively to mid-off
well that's a half volley which is smashed, albeit not fully in control, slicing it just past backward point. Sarwan is salmon-like but his impressive dive is all in vain
too straight, but de Villiers is beaten for pace here and can't time it as well he might
and this ducks back into de Villiers who tries to cut it, but is cramped. Again too quick for him
this is fine bowling, it really is. Quick, short, bouncing and lifting on de Villiers who wisely left it alone - but that came from nowhere. An impressive, surprise bouncer

well he's done a Smith here, and somehow got four. Half a step down the pitch, and tries to hit him over the head before deciding to close the face and sponge it over midwicket. Mistimed, but he got enough on it for four
a full toss bunged to cover - but Bravo is quick there, and sends in a missile-like throw...but it's wide of the stumps. And the batsman's home, anyway
pitched straight and that's defended on the back foot
touch of width and that's rightly cut down hard to gully but a tidy piece of fielding cuts the ball off, no run
unconvincing back-foot defensive from de Villiers, just about getting an edge on that as the ball falls forward on off, out of harm
better, a more solid shot to one which pitches on off stump this time, on a good length
outside off this time, opens his shoulders and tries to cover-drive that one, but an edge flies low, out of danger, through gully
top shot. The ball was straight and only just a touch short and that was well whipped off the hips through square, a crashing pull shot
just a touch short and that's a very nice shot by de Villiers, lofted high off the base of the bat, deliberately lifted over the inner ring and on towards extra cover
nice angle from Powell, tempting the batsman to fish outside off stump as that one arcs just a touch away from him
short outside off this time and de Villiers does not miss out; waited and just crashed that in front of midwicket and it rockets away - it had timing, it had power and it got runs
good work by Lara on the straight boundary and that brings up South Africa's fifty - de Villiers just leaning into that straight drive
class from Kallis this time, just striding into the cover-drive with a mere caress of the bat, finds the gap and the ball races away
strays onto leg and Kallis is so good on his legs, turning his wrists into that shot which runs through square
on the money immediately, pushing that one quickly past the outside edge in a dangerous area and the batsman leaves that alone
on leg this time, short enough to be swished out to the man at deep square
neat delivery, that one doing a touch in the air, moving away off the seam and drawing the batsman into going for a drive. Beaten
wider and that's some quality fielding from Chanderpaul, but not the catch the crowd thought it was - it didn't quite carry to him at cover, and he did well to get his body behind it on the bounce
a misfield this time, Sarwan at midwicket letting the drive go through his fingers
drags it a touch short on off and Kallis shuffles across his off stump to drive that in front of midwicket
on a good length first up and pitching on off, pushing the batsman onto his back foot to defend
short and that's gone just in front of point for a one-bounce four, a crisp aerial drive which doesn't go as straight as he'd like - in fact it went square
superb shot, really superb. A touch wider and Kallis just stepped back and gave himself room to launch that one over cover. That's the fifty partnership

comes forward and walks across the bowler before the ball's even been delivered, turning that off his front foot to the midwicket boundary. Pollard nearly got hold of it inside the boundary, but is honest in signalling four - his foot connected with the trope while the ball was still in his hand
walked across his stumps again and walked into that one, flaying it in of midwicket with another strong drive
shuffles that one down the corridor on a good length and that's left alone outside off
just outside off, the batsman goes down on one knee, opens the face, and plays that down to wide third man
across the righthander, but with too much width to be menacing, and that's easily driven out to the cover boundary
pitched up there, straight, and that's driven without much fuss to mid-off
saw the batsman sniffing over to the off side and tried to send the ball even wider, but obviously went too wide
outside off and third man has to run out behind point to retrieve that one
straight and that's poked down into the leg-side for a quick single of strike-stealingness
oops, that one slipped out, a waist-high full toss that's worked down into square
cuts in off the seam and Kallis goes to cut it, misses and there's a rubbish appeal from Bravo "Howz..." he begins... before having another go "How is that?"
width and that one's cut straight to the fielder at cover
this one's more like it - Bravo getting the edge but Ramdin drops it as he's too close to the stumps (standing up)
driven into the covers this time
outside off and played down without much fuss
driven forward to mid-off

excellent ball on leg, that goes right through the batsman and there was a very woody noise which sounded like the bail coming off, but it was the ball connecting with the splice and rushing on past the keeper - de Villiers is a lucky boy, because he was a beaten one, there
on leg again and that's clipped down into square this time
on leg again and this one is eased into the covers on the front foot
on leg once more and that's worked off the front foot into short midwicket

oh hello, how did that miss? Didn't bounce as high as de Villiers expected, and the batsman shaped to pull that through midwicket. He ended up squaring himself up to the stumps and the ball squinted past the off stump... by millimetres
driven straight to Gayle in the covers and the excellent fielder makes no mistake of course
drags it down a touch short, and there's width, too; the batsman duly obliges with a cover drive but it's tidied up inside the rope
short and wide again, but the ball's rising this time and Kallis waits on tiptoes to lace that off the back foot through point
goes for a repeat of the shot earlier in the over - this time the ball does have the height, but de Villiers plays over it
up there and dug out, driven into the covers, and that should have been a clear run-out chance, but Gayle failed to pick it up cleanly in the first place
driven off the back foot straight to the man at point this time
on leg and there's a hopeful shout of "Catch it" from Ramdin as the ball pops way short of the man in at leg
plants that one on a good length and AB de V nearly runs himself out there, driving that one straight to cover and how he wasn't out... well, the throw missed
worked easily off the back foot behind point
shorter ball and de Villiers just helps himself to a straight drive, which will ease the pressure a touch
fuller delivery, on off, and that's driven straight to the man at cover - this time they decide not to risk one of their risky singles
pushed right up there and that's cut down, defensively, off the back foot to gully
pushed up there and dug out from off stump to the covers
an easy single into the covers which brings up the hundred and that's trumpeted by ... well, the trumpeter
short and cut away strongly behind point
slower ball, de Villiers picks it up early and sends that one over long-on with a bloody drive which just to say clears the rope and brings up his half-century
on leg and that's tucked away in front of midwicket
pushes the batsman onto the back foot and that's squeezed into the covers
very low full toss bombs in at the shins, but that's flicked away
over the wicket and it's too wide of his leg stump, easily turned off his hip behind square
an authoritative slap through the covers, but deep extra is out on the boundary to prevent four
another massive blow from de Villiers, but without timing or placing it and it lands like a mortar in the outfield over cover
better delivery this time, nice and full, and it's pushed back to him
worked off his legs, milked, for another single
short of a length, cut hard but straight to point
just angling back into the batsman who is back onto his stumps and defending it off the back foot
nearly! Short of a length and he pulled it, got a bottom edge and it just fell short of Lara at short midwicket
elegantly driven on the up but straight to cover
sliced on the front foot past backward point for two. Neatly placed
full, straight  -  just slipping down the leg side and the batsman rather misses out here, the ball ballooning off his pad out into the off side
and he gives himself a touch of room outside off before timing it into the covers. But again he can't pierce the gap
he stands tall and punches it to cover, but straight to the man there
a gift, frankly, on leg stump but he misses out
elegantly, expansively smashed - but straight to point
nearly! Smacked again to Bravo at point who picked up with one hand, threw to the non-striker's end where Kallis had already given up hope...but the throw was wider
ooh that was mighty, mighty close, just angling across de Villiers who played and missed and it was neatly taken by the keeper, whipping off the bails...but the batsman kept his foot behind the line
punched on the front foot back to the bowler. Super piece of punching
punched down the ground to long-on and there's his half-century
a full toss which is pushed to cover. Smashed would be more accurate but, either way, it was hit straight to the fielder
and he's hit him. We've not had many batsman felled in this Cup so far, and nor was Kallis felled there...but the ball rocketed into his midriff following a mis-timed pull
just short of a length, again de Villiers gives himself a touch of room outside leg before flicking it, ungainly, to midwicket. No run there
fine shot, on the up, slapping him through the infield - but just for a single
down on one knee, Kallis launches into another drive but again lacks placement and it falls short of mid-off
a wristy flick, using the pace of the delivery to work it behind square for one
punched on the back foot to cover
turned through midwicket for a single
cut through the covers
just short of a length and he climbs into it, driving it out to deep extra cover
and it's worked through midwicket for another milking single
and immediately he causes Kallis problems with one outside off; Kallis goes for an expansive drive, inside edging into his boot and very nearly into his stumps
excellent line again, on a good length and it's defended
ooh and Kallis does a bit of an Irish jig here, stepping outside off and flamingo-flicking it through midwicket
ah, very well played from de Villiers. A forward defence, dropping it dead into the off side and they scamper through for a single
Kallis steps outside off and flicks it through midwicket
full and straight, pinged back to the bowler
a shorter ball, cheekily dabbed off the face of the bat past the vacant slip down to third man...who can't prevent two
little bit too wide of the off stump, and it's late cut
straighter this time and Kallis walks into this flick, and, well, flicks it to deep midwicket for another easy single
far, far too wide but he rather misses out here. Lack of pace from Pollard and Kallis clatters it on the front foot but straight into the covers
stands tall and works this down to long-on this time
very slow, too wide, dabbed down to third man
cut into the covers
pushed down the ground - again a "walking" shot
ooh well bowled indeed. Swinging into the batsman who again takes a step outside leg, and is forced to really clamp down on this yorker-length delivery on middle stump
cracked behind square, down on one knee, to a wide third man
excellent line just outside off, and angled into the covers
Kallis takes another step to the off side, displaying all three of his stumps but flicks it with ease through midwicket
on off stump, it's defended on the front foot. Good length
splodged to backward point. Absolutely no pace from the bowler here, which might be a blessing in disguise for West Indies
cracked through the covers and they sprint the single, Kallis wants two - de Villiers most certainly does not, but they get it comfortably in the end owing to another poor West Indian throw
worked to extra cover
late cut down to third man
another wristy, elegant  flick from de Villiers - more tip'n'run - and they grab another single
just outside off and pushed, nurdled to leg
poor ball, asking to be cut and Kallis obliges with a late cut past the diving backward point
fuller this time and pushed back to Gayle
full but wide of the off stump, clattered to deep extra cover
much better length this time but South Africa grab another single with an easy push to cover
another outrageous flick from de Villiers for a zero
outside off, on a good length, but that's easily left alone
pushed right up there, driven back out to long-on and that's another misfield which allows a single-that-shouldn't-have-been
outside off and that's scooped into the covers off the back foot
and that's cut low in front of point
sprayed fine down leg and that's worked very fine through fine leg for a fine four (any more fines and you're fined - Ed)
too short and that's cut away into the off side
down the wicket and that's driven to long-on
just too full and that's jinked into the covers
dragged down and that's swept round to the man on the 45
tucked off the toes to square
outside off, the batsman stands tall, opens the face and jabs it down to gully
rocks onto his back foot and drives, without much power, into the covers
pushes that one up there but the batsman just stands firm and guides it easily into the covers and that's 150 partnership up
off stump half-volley given some welly in the form of a cover-drive which shoots off the bottom third of the bat, de Villiers just leaning into that one
pushed up there, straight, and de Villiers is firm in defence, playing that down off the back foot
good ball, cutting back in off the seam at an awkward angle; the batsman gets over it and works it to mid-on
squeezed into the leg-side and de Villiers gets the strike back
outside off and that's driven aerially towards the covers, through the covers, and on to the boundary
outside off, the batsman unleashes big arms at that one (not literally), looking to launch through the covers
driven through the covers, a more orthodox shot this time, and they put the pressure on the fielders well there, with some neat running
poked down off the back foot into gully
on middle and that's driven to mid-on
driven off the toes to Bravo at a wide long-on
out to midwicket and there's a quick single
over the wicket, outside off and there's an outside edge which goes up and down, forlornly, nowhere near the fielder behind point
on the front foot and that's nibbled to point this time
turns away from the batsman outside off and that's cut to point
pushed right up there and defended straight
the batsman makes room, it's not a pretty sight as he backs away and clubs the ball towards cover - still, they get two
a quick single, this one to the gap in the covers
worked to midwicket
Gayle strikes! At last the deadlock is broken! Kallis moved back (and then forward) to give himself some room, there, but he didn't make contact as the ball turned back into him and took middle stump
outside off and that's defended into the covers sturdily
straight and that's tucked off the thigh to midwicket to bring up the gentlest of singles
outside off, a touch short, and de Villiers works that out on the front foot in front of midwicket
de Villiers pulls out of the shot this time, just turning it square with a stun of the bat
pushed right up there and that's defended on the front foot
outside off and that's cut away off the back foot to point
flight to that one and the batsman gets over it, driving to cover
oh, beats the batsman with a clever yorker, de Villiers coming down the wicket
flapped to cover this time
more air, this one's driven into the covers and some neater fielding (ie less of a loopy throw) would have done for the batsman
turned square this time
straying down leg and that's well swished fine
comes forward to defend
works that to square leg to bring up his maiden one-day century. He jumps in the air, punching as he goes, lifts a hand in salute and then salutes the balcony, then the crowd
worked into the leg-side for an easy single
brings his bat down late, but deliberately, on that one as he works the ball into midwicket and that's South Africa's 200
wide and that turns away from the batsman, just too thin to be a wide
right out towards the ball which is very wide, and that's cut away to point
driven out to the covers this time for a quick single
wide outside off and turning wider, the batsman cuts that one straight to point, where it bounces just short of the fielders
driven out to the cover again
outside off again and that's lashed out towards the cover boundary on one knee, but de Villiers falls over and hobbles towards the non-striker's end
short, and de Villiers comes down the track as best he can, down on one knee, too, and that's whipped high and hard over midwicket
defended forward this time
worked to square
Gibbs waits for that one, short, and that's hooked off one knee through midwicket
eased to midwicket this time
down the track and that's hit straight, clean and long over long-on
outside off and that's driven out to deep extra cover
and he's gone for it, has he got all of it? Yes - it's slog-swept with monstrous power over deep midwicket
again outside his leg stump; again he slog sweeps; again it sails over deep midwicket! This is brilliant hitting and the momentum of his bat-swishing sends him tumbling to the ground
slapped back past the bowler with disdain, if not altogether timing it that well
angling into his pads and it's paddled through midwicket

what a magnificent shot that is. Down on one knee, a yorker, and he squirts it past backward point for four. His cramp is really giving him trouble, though, and he limps away from that shot in great difficulty
and he starts reasonably well with a full ball on leg stump but Gibbs can get it away for a single, and get de Villiers back on strike
wide of the off stump, full, but de Villiers just leans back and cracks it through cover. The bloke can hardly stand up straight but he's timing the ball brilliantly
pumps this into the leg side
clunked down the ground for a calm single
a full toss - nearly a beamer - which he clatters over the bowler's head

this is ridiculous batting, albeit fairly dreadful bowling. It was a half volley, begging to be hit, so de Villiers collapsed onto one knee and laced it through extra cover. No one moved, apart from the batsman who fell over again - his hamstring seems to have completely gone
very wide of the off stump; de Villiers can't reach it, flaying his bat (and body) at it
down the pitch and clattered down to long-off...but without placing it properly
a full toss - and a dot ball - smacked to mid-on

on leg stump, right in the block hole and he powers it to Bravo who runs round from long-on...and, well that's a fabulous piece of fielding, running to his right, picking up with one hand and preventing two
cracked over his head without timing
down the leg side and wided
deflected down to fine leg
and immediately he strikes as de Villiers tries to cheekily flick one over short fine leg...but he just cannot time it, and there ends a brilliant innings
a very firm, orthodox defensive push to mid-off
full and straight, worked down to long-on but just for a single
a little floater there outside off which is worked to leg for another milky single
excellent ball which deserves to be a "dot" but it's the mad hour, and a defensive push to the off hands them a single
a yorker on leg stump, flicked with great energy down to fine leg and this'll be four more. Pollard makes a complete hash of it on the boundary - the ball zooting past his meek attempt to field
just so simple. A step outside the leg stump, and he cracks it over the top for four. Cleanly, elegantly struck
oh that's big; a full toss, Gibbs goes down on one knee and slog-sweeps it in front of square for a vast six
better ball, but still a full toss which is creamed to cover
down the leg side and nearly a wide...in fact that might well have been called a wide, but the umpire resists
much better; fuller and straighter, cramping him for room and it's pushed back out into the covers without much timing
it's another full toss, it's another slog across the line but it's timed brilliantly and sails over midwicket for six
on off stump, the batsman takes half a step down the pitch and hammers it to cover who gets half a hand to it, preventing four
on leg stump and flicked down to fine leg, and it's timed well too. But Pollard makes up for his error in the previous over and saves four
fine ball, full and straight - almost yorker length - but it's bump-balled over the bowler's head for a single
dropped and that just about sums up West Indies' day. It was short, Gibbs went to pull it and got a top edge, skying it to Bradshaw at third man who had just a few metres to run. And he shelled it
bump-balled over the bowler's head
good, full delivery - following the batsman's movement to leg - and it's blocked out
and here's another full toss and another free-swinging six over the bowler's head
fantastic shot, just spearing into his legs and Boucher makes it into a full toss, driving it with great power past mid-off's despairing drive for another four
picked off his toes to long-on for a paltry single
another remarkable flip off his toes. A leg side gift and he just flipped it, paddled it, over leg very nearly for six
very full this time - that's the place to bowl - and it's fairly hammered into the covers but just for a single. Excellent stop from Pollard (I think)
another full toss but he gets away with it...clunked to mid-on
ah, well bowled, full and straight and it's worked behind square to a short fine leg who throws down the stumps
down the leg side and he tries to clatter it into the ocean, but can't quite time it this time and it scuds out to deep square leg
oh dear. That's right in the blockhole - you cannot bowl there to him - and he simply swings through the line, smashing it over long-on for another six
ooh nearly bowled him, on leg stump and Boucher again tries to smack him over midwicket but misses
excellent ball again - this new line is troubling the batsman here who is cramped for room. Outside leg and again he swings and misses
pasted on the full over his head but just for a single
what a shot. I keep saying it, but only because it's true. It was right in the slot, the perfect length, and it's smacked over midwicket for another one
take that. Another dreadful ball, far, far too short and this time Boucher just swings it around the corner for another six
just a touch fuller this time, enough to prevent it going for four as Boucher times it down to long-on
that is savage. Again it's just on a length, and Gibbs just timed it quite remarkably straight back over the bowler's head for another six, probably the day's biggest
fuller, and this time they get just a single
this is obscene - on a length, and it's swung over midwicket. Simple.
that's the place to bowl, full, straight, on off stump, giving the batsman no room at all - and it's squeezed out to cover
a slower ball which comes out as a full toss, Boucher misreads it and skies it back to the bowler who just takes a few steps to his right to take a simple catch
good length, almost a yorker which is fiercely timed down to long-off and they steal a single. No, they want two - and, well, another catastrophic piece of fielding allows them through
lofted without really timing it - the ball lands like a mortar over the bowler's head and long-on does well to prevent four
terrible ball - an attempted slower ball, miles down the leg side which Gibbs paddles for four more
ah well bowled, Bravo, full and clattered into the ground

inn2.comm: over the wicket, slants that one across the lefthander; there's a touch of width and he slashes down into the ground
a touch of width again, but Gayle gets hold of it this time and cheers greet his open-batted steer down to third man
straighter, and full, but Chanderpaul clunks that one back to mid-off to get off the mark
that one rushes past the outside edge, but without much danger off taking a snick
in that good area again, and that's just left alone by Gayle
Pollock beats Gayle with one which flirts past his outside edge, cutting away from him off the seam, and that's tidied by Boucher
up there, outside off and Chanderpaul strides tall into that straight drive, but doesn't go out of his crease, as he sees the ball racing straight to the fielder
pushed up there, straight, and that's defended forward
an early sign of aggression from Chanderpaul, striding into the ball before it's released; a touch of width and that's laced through gully but the cheers of the crowd can't will it all the way
poked into the covers and the man there gets a hand on it
on off and that's driven neatly to cover for an easy single
comes from quite wide of the crease and angles that across the lefthander on a good length, and it's poked down into the covers
early success for South Africa as the ball's placed outside off and that's driven straight into Smith's bucket hands at mid-off for an easy catch
leaves that one alone outside off first up
outside off again, short, and that's laced through cover
more width and that's cut off the back foot into the covers
on leg, just outside leg in fact, and that's tucked off the toes round through wide fine leg
driven into the covers this time
angled across  on a good length and that's prodded down into the covers
width again and that's driven over the inner ring to cover
on off and that's taken from there and pushed in front of midwicket for a comfortable two
oh, nearly brought a second wicket for South Africa then, a loose swish away from the body
driven to a deepish mid-off, a quick call, and they run through
up there, on middle-and-leg, and there's not much room to squeeze that to mid-off for a single, but he manages all the same
straight, straight as you like, and that's defended down solidly
another straight one but that's a tip-and-top tip-and-run towards mid-off
was trying to work that one into midwicket and his bat came through at an awkward angle, the ball going straight in the end
angles slightly away from the lefthander, pitching on middle and veering to leg, but it's just short enough to be pushed into the off side
more curve, this time into the lefthander, and it's on leg and turned to leg off the leg
turned off the legs again and there's some slide-and-throw work out at cow corner
outside off and he really launches into that on-drive; unfortunately, it wasn't timed properly and finds the fielder
width and that's a very nice dab indeed - waited for it and just timed it away between the fielders around point
goes over the top this time, with a launch over the off-side ring
dabbed into the covers and Peterson does well to send the batsman back with a turn-and-shy
his feet get stuck in the crease, but no matter because he carves that cut behind point and they come back for the second
steered off the back foot to mid-off and that's another good quick single
straight and that's a lovely straight drive back down the ground but it's cut off and they're kept to the single
not much width really, but it's played late and square, really well played indeed, throwing the arms at that one and angling it away
driven to cover where a slight misfield, from Gibbs surprisingly, allows the run - some classic yesnoing going on beforehand

they risk a single to long-off, this one hit too hard to allow them to get through comfortably; instead they get through uncomfortably. Smith didn't miss by much and if he'd have hit, he'd have struck wicket gold
whisked away in front of square, where Ntini chases that down inside the rope
across the lefthander who strokes it easily to point
outside off, a touch short, but the cover-drive finds Peterson at, yes you guessed, cover
mistimed that one, short and outside off, and pulls it right into his leg
angles that across off and that's driven straight to Smith
straight, up there, and that's tickled to the man at midwicket
pulled to midwicket this time
outside off and that's cut to Peterson at cover
bustles to the crease, but gets it just a touch wrong and that's driven out easily enough to long-on
turned off the hips to square
driven back past Nel but it's too late for a run by the time he thinks about one
outside leg and that's timed well off the hips, the crowd booing as it's picked up near the rope
huge bouncer, and that keeps lifting. Gayle is so unimpressed, staring him down, standing there with his hand on his hip
turned off the hips again and they do well to make the three, even when Boucher collects at his end and shies the sticks at the other
on middle and that's swished out to the midwicket boundary and there's an attempt to stop it on the rope, but the Bosman ruling is that he connected - and he did
driven to the covers
short, width outside off and gets its just desserts; Gayle punishing that in typical nonchalant style
too short again, and on leg this time, and that's whipped off the hips, but didn't quite get the placement he'd have liked
great pull, so clean, just a 'plink' off the face as that's hooked away in front of midwicket for a one-bounce four
driven into short midwicket
short, wide, left alone
and that's fuller this time, clunked with a "yeah yeah yeah" call to Gayle and they steal a thoroughly sneaksome single
that's well bowled from Nel, cutting it into the left hander and cramping him for room
a heavy, low full toss which is plonked to mid-off, a single is stolen
ooh and he's chipped this off his toes just beyond Kallis at long-on. Mistimed but Kallis wasn't out of the blocks quick enough

good catch! Smith stepped outside leg, and guided it off the face of the bat to de Villiers - twanging hamstring and all - who dived in from point and took an excellent, low catch. Smith wasn't sure that he held it, but de Villiers gave him the thumbs up

pulled, without timing it, through mid-on. Pollock gives chase, rather pedestrianly so, and almost fingertips it back...but drags the ball, and himself, over the line. He mouths "ooooh" afterwards. I don't know why
better ball, just short of a length. Gayle remains on the back foot and blocks it back to Hall

just short of a length and it's worked to leg for a quick single. Well, they better be quick - Gayle hesitated a touch and Prince, at short midwicket, had just one stump to aim at...and he's nailed it
pulled with Lara-like one-legged flair around the corner
on leg stump and it bobbles off his pad
a poor delivery which deserves four but all the luck is going South Africa's way and Sarwan, like a big winner, whips it straight to midwicket
Just short of a length, rising on the left hander who plonks it to leg
firmly defended on the front foot
crashed into the off side to AB de Villiers who, well, he makes a fantastic stop, swivels, throws down the stumps and misses by just inches
pushed aerially to mid-on. Lara again hesitates, and the throw from Smith at mid-on was just wide
pushed to leg
turned off his hip for a quick single
just wide of the off stump and late-cut to backward point, Gibbs, who makes a brilliant dive to his right to stop
drifting down the leg side, it's worked off his pads for a shingle
terrific line from Hall, on middle-and-off, forcing Lara to defend
loses his line here and Lara nudges it through midwicket for a single
cracked to cover
neatly cut, late, allowing the ball to come onto him
oh, terrific line from Nel here, angling it into Lara before cutting it away from his rather unconvincing prod
a tighter line on off stump which he defends
a vast grunt from Nel - surely one of the loudest, most audible of bowlers around - before unleashing one on off stump which Lara again blocks out
pushed out to cover
deftly played from Sarwan, plucking a leg-side drifter from a furious Nel down to the fine leg fence
and Lara just guides this with soft hands down to third man. He's so deft at that stroke, almost plucking the ball out of the wicketkeeper's gloves at the last moment
Sarwan is more heavy-footed and squirts this square
and a play and a miss outside off
on leg stump and Lara easily turns it to leg
drifting down the right hander's leg stump but he can't make anything of it
magnificently, authoritatively driven on the up through the covers
angling into the left hander who pushes it off the back foot
good line, just in the corridor outside off and it's pushed back to him
oh dear. Nel is going to go berserk at this, drifting it down Sarwan's leg side who just pulls it around the corner for four
better ball on off stump, angled down to third man
crashed to cover
oh what a shot from Lara. A good old fashioned bosh outside off - a laid-back carve through the covers - for four
too short, allowing him to nurdle it around the corner
Lara just guides it down to third man, running it off the face of the bat
cut outside off down to third man. Again, too wide
just worked off his pads; the wider, short fine leg scampers after it to prevent two. Or three, or more
yet again Hall loses his line and Sarwan whips it off his legs
cracked with a Caribbean flourish of the bat to point
short, wide, cut, but straight to point
lovely, lovely shot - that's class from Sarwan, flicking it with immensely elastic wrists through square leg for four
dabbed down to the off side this time
outside off, and pushed into the covers
oooh that wasn't too convincing, although with Lara it is often difficult to tell. Slashed down to third man
smoothed through the covers this time
ooh he's out, is he? No, but very nearly...Lara out-foxed by a slower ball which is spooned back to Kallis on the bounce
another slower ball but Lara's wise to Kallis's cunning, and works it to leg
this cuts back into Sarwan who, very late and with soft hands, just angles it through the vacant slip down to third man

oh no, Lara's gone. Good bowling change from Smith, Kallis's slight change of pace causing Lara problems. It was wide of the off stump and, frankly, deserved to be smacked through the covers...but he just couldn't get to the pitch of the ball, and inside-edged onto his stumps
just short of a length, and it's worked through midwicket
drifting down the leg side
outside off and that's cut away behind point where the man does a nice seal flop to stop the ball
cuts back in off the seam to the righthander, it's played down to point again but only for the single
took the pace off that one, just pressing the brakes a tad, and that's cut into the ground, the batsman failing to deal with the change of speed
outside off and that's cut to gully where it's Gibbs's slide-and-stop show
a touch of width and that's a rare straight drive from Sarwan, over the top of mid-off
strays onto leg and that's a gentle single to long-on
right up there, the ball deviating in off the seam and that's just defended forward. Peterson picks it up and has some chat as he sends it round the ring via Pollock
bangs that one down at a nice cuttable line and length, and that's whipped away off the back foot into space, but that's well dealt with
short, straying down leg, and that's tucked off the hips down to Hall
on off and that veers towards leg, up there, and pushed into short midwicket
straight, up there, and that's turned square
pushes the batsman onto his back foot and that's defended into the off side
on off and that was driven to cover
straight, yorker, but that's played away to square
pushed up there, dribbled to point, but there's no single on
outside off and that's driven into the covers and quickly returned
that reared up, arced away, and that's well swerved away from. I'd have him in my limbo dancing team
driven straight to long-on for an easy single
outside off and that's steered from a crouching position down to Kemp at third man
pushed right up there and that's defended into the leg side
short, width, and that's cut away through point where Kemp does some tidy fielding just inside the rope
pops a leading edge into the covers and there's an overthrow over to Ntini during the attempted run-out as the batsman was trying to get back into his crease at the non-striker's end
oh, gets a deliberate steer to third man wrong and nearly outside-edges into Boucher's hands, the ball just flying short, Kallis's hands flying to his head
short, straight and that's a great shot, lifted off the bottom of the bat and driven wide of long-off

and the move pays off straight away. Short - but not that short - and the batsman doesn't have enough room on the drive to midwicket. Gibbs is all smiles and he points his index finger in the air, because he can
outside off and that's steered down to point to bring up his, yes, first one-day run
a good area, and that's defended forward
pushed right up there, defended, and Pollock asks "Aaaaaaaaaa?" It's not aaa-ut, there was bat on it
outside off and that's chopped down unconvincingly
straight and that's whipped into midwicket with fast hands. Fast legs do the rest
rushed up there, but with a touch of width and it's guided out easily enough through point
bangs that one down and a bouncer flies down the channel, the batsman springing back like a coil
slower ball, picked at the last minute, the batsman adjusting to take that from middle, rolling his wrists into the midwicket
on off, more wrist rolling, and that's driven out to long-on
more of the short stuff, but that's well played, the steer just eluding Boucher's outstretched right hand
pushed right up there and that's driven into the covers
on leg and that's whipped away behind square to bring up his half-century in 46 balls and that's his second World Cup fifty, his 25th in all one-dayers
"Oh" says Boucher and so do I as that one's on a good length, up there, but the batsman's just saved by a whiff of edge
nibbles in at the batsman from a good length, but he does well to nobble that back out to gully

oh, a big shout and I've no idea why that wasn't given out, but Daryl Harper's explaining to Pollock. Unfortunately I can't lipread - a ha, but I can watch the replay, and it hit outside the line of off stump. Good decision, of course
right up there, straying to leg, and that's swished forward
driven into the covers for a quick single of strike-stealing proportion
on off and that's jinked down to the man waiting for it inside the boundary at deep point with a neat cut
inched into the covers, Gibbs shies at the stumps at the non-striker's end, misses the stumps, hits the striker
turned down off the hips to fine leg and there's an urgent single there - a direct hit would have been close... in fact, miles out (comparatively of course)
slower ball and that's the shot of a tailender, swishing out at it and it flies tamely over the outside edge
on leg, he turns that down to Boucher and sets off walking until he realises that Boucher has pouched'er
stands tall and dabs a straight one down and thinks about setting off to run, before realising that to do so would be unwise
driven off the toes into midwicket and that's well picked and winged back in
that one cuts in off the seam, keeps low, and the batsman does well to poke that one down
slower ball, tossed up there, but that's driven easily on the up to mid-off for a quick single
short and that's punted over the top of long-off, another good example by Sarwan, his eyes watching the ball all the way
pushed right up there, inched down to gully
strayed down leg and the batsman did well to get something on it, 'twas his  pad, and that's worked all the way fine
slower ball did him... but didn't quite get him - that one cutting back in ever so slightly, there's a big swing but he's through the shot before the ball arrived. Got away with it
attempted bouncer and Kallis ends up on his knees in the effort, that one pulled in front of midwicket
backs away from that one, exposing all the sticks, and he does well to cut that behind point - Hall doing well to keep them down to one from the deep
cuts in, keeps low, and the batsman is beaten, leaning over his bat as he tries to play that one

awful, awful. A straight one from Kallis, on a good length, and Pollard comes down the track to try to pull that through midwicket, yorks himself, tucks his bat under his arm and he's on his way. Middle peg goes wheeling
bouncer crashes into his shoulder as he goes on the hook immediately
a bit of a leg-side drifter to greet my first ball back on air which is worked fine for a single
half a shout from Boucher - 60-70% raucousness - to one which rapped him on the pads
good line and length, forcing him back onto his stumps and he pushed back to the bowler with a straight bat off the back foot
very slow indeed, 68mph, but accurate, straight and defended
another unerringly accurate one on off stump which he tries to cut, but can only splodge it out into the off side
and he gets it away with a workmanlike nudge through midwicket
the rankest of long-hops which is paddled around to deep square leg
ah, a touch of deft class there, just waiting for it and guiding it down to a short third man
lofted, straight as a dye, over Smith's head. Terrific, effortless stroke
too full, clattered to deep backward point

fine catch from Peterson, the substitute, diving forward at short midwicket. Ramdin flicked it feebly, with no intent, no placement and it bobbled up tantalisingly to Peterson who dived forward, taking it an inch or so from the turf. Made it look very easy
clunked past him down to long-off
raps him on the pads with a searing, straight delivery
pushed out into the off side
an ugly swat outside off, smudging it to extra cover
neatly struck; a low full toss which is gracefully timed out to deep point
drifting down leg and Sarwan deflects it neatly, without fuss, for a single
and a swing-and-a-miss to finish the over
turned to mid-on

what an effort from Ntini out at long-on. Sarwan clobbered it over Smith's head - a skier which looped forever in the air; Ntini ran to his left and got a hand to it, but shelled it. He did, though, save six
clattered through the covers; Prince, diving to his right on the boundary at deep extra, makes a rare fielding cock-up allowing four
too short, too wide, and cut with power past backward point. Boucher urges his fielder to "chase it, chase it" as though he doesn't know what to do out there, but it was hit with too much power
shot! Terrible ball, mind, short and wide again but Sarwan just lofted it over extra cover with superb timing for four
plinked to leg for a single
Sarwan steps outside leg, as has been his tendency in the past few overs, and cracks it square for some more
pushed off the back foot into the covers

firmly forward on the front foot, pushing it to short extra cover. He cries yes and runs; Sarwan automatically responds by running before realising what a catastrophic run it would be, as the fielder picks up and throws down the stumps. But misses
cracked to point
angled off the back foot to point
left alone outside off to end the over
another extravagant step outside leg from Sarwan, late cutting down to third man
carved off the back foot - here comes another comical piece of running as the throw comes in from Peterson, but it's wide and Boucher can't whip off the bails
nudged off his pads
worked off his hip for another cheeky single
ooh nearly. Sliced off the splice, just short of a wide first slip. In fact it's a second slip
on off stump this time but it's cleverly nurdled to leg for another single
an Ntini-length (just short of a good'un) which is guided to cover
defended off the back foot
hammered off the back foot, a slicing cut short of gully
on off stump this time, hurrying Bradshaw who, crab-like, pokes it to leg
pushed off the back foot
and a good line again to finish the over, Bradshaw just pushing it to mid-off
short of a length, Sarwan leans back and carves it to deep extra
he tries to pull, but succeeds in just whacking it into his pads
oh well played, late-cutting it between Boucher and the second slip (who is, in effect, the wide lone slip) down to third man
flicked off his legs through midwicket
well bowled, just cutting this back into Sarwan - but he's in good nick and just times it off the back foot
ah well bowled! A slower ball which Bradshaw plays at and misses

goddim, and with him goes any last remnants of hope the West Indies might've had. He tried to take Ntini on, tried to hit him over the top - but his front-footed slap was mistimed straight to Pollock at mid off
solidly forward and defended on the front foot
pulled and this'll be caught...by the grass, as it lands safely
on off stump, it rattles into his pads and wobbles out into the off side
ooh nearly the next wicket, as it's spooned just over Ntini's head...and just short of Pollock at mid-on
a slap to mid-off ends the over
angling back into the batsman who is back into his crease and defending
lovely shot for one, a flourishing Caribbean carve to deep extra
well bowled! Lovely ball cutting away from a wary prod on the front foot
flipped off his legs and they scamper through. Nel gallops down in one huge stride to collect the ball, collapsing onto it with pantomime hilarity, and tries to throw down the stumps but misses
lofted to deep extra cover; it lands like a mortar in the sand
airily, waftily poked
swished into the leg side
tidy delivery, cutting back sharply into the batsman, who defended forward
stays over the wicket and the batsman drives out to long-off
show of intent from the batsman, coming down the track and hooking at that one, missing, and it sails through
hello! The crowd love it and so do we - a flat-batted six which goes right over long-on, high and hard. Have some
short and Calypso - some more of what we like - he hooks that round on one leg through midwicket and it travels some
on leg and that's driven behind square
short and that's whipped over to midwicket, and there's an overthrow too
full, right up there (tautology, sorry), and that's cut down into the ground from a squatting position, the ball travelling down to third man
defended forward
outside off, flirting away from the batsman and if he had connected with that pull he would have found the next zip code. He didn't. So he didn't
walks into that shot, a lovely flick of the wrists through midwicket. Love that shot, and that was very well timed, too
straight and again tries to swish that one through midwicket, but gets under the ball and Boucher tidies up
on middle-and-off and that's tickled very, very fine indeed - quite an extraordinary shot, really, certainly very cheeky
low full toss, the batsman waits, crouches into that one, and drives through cover
comes wide of the crease, spears that in from an awkward length, and right up there, and it's poked into the off side
tries to pull that one, it's too full, but it's an act of desperation, and that is mistimed to midwicket
pushed right up there and that's dug out with a forward defensive
shuffles that one down the corridor and there's yet another air shot
left alone outside off this time
stays over the wicket, by the way, and the batsman tries to open the face to run it down to third man
more of the fresh-air goodness
yet another scythe through the air
a touch of width on off and that's pushed forward off the back foot, an odd-looking shot, really, it looked like he was sitting in a chair, without the chair, and that rolls out to deep extra cover
and he does run in, driving that one to mid-on for a quick single
slower ball, clever, squirting that just outside off and the batsman's tempted - he misses
driven in front of midwicket off the front foot and beats Prince's best efforts on the rope
huge roar from the crowd - that (very) wide down off brings up the 250
driven out firmly to long-off and there's a quick single
on middle-and-leg and that's squeezed into the leg side
outside off and that's driven on one knee into the covers
waited for that one and defended down off the back foot
down the track and had to settle for a whip into midwicket (and not midwhippet as I bizarrely nearly typed, then again I am from oop north)
goes for it this time and sends slog-sweeps it, sending it looping high - my, what a lovely parabola - but straight to the man at deep deep square leg
comes forward and clips that with a crisp, soft drive into the covers
defended tidily
plenty of outdrift, and that's just tucked into the covers
on leg and Collymore clips that nicely off the legs out to deep square and they're prevented from getting two by some great work from Prince
drives that out to long-off where a smiling Gibbs rolls it back underarm
slower ball nearly ends the match, the batsman pulling back to give himself cutting room
reverse swing and the batsman uses the bat as a crutch and a defensive mechanism in stabbing down on the ball - top French cricketness
driven out to long-on
slower ball sails harmlessly down the off channel - nevertheless the batsman is tempted
drags that one down and that's a huge shot! Down the track and smashed in front of midwicket
another one! That was like watching a replay, what a great shot. The crowd, needless to say, well you know what they're doing
turns that back in at him and it pops up awkwardly; he does well to open the face and without really controlling it, work it down to third man
taken off the toes and that's swished to midwicket
outside off, and the batsman chases that nearly-wide
spears that one in at the legs, but it's turned patiently square
right up there and that's driven off the legs in front of midwicket
defended this time
pushed right up there and that's poked back forward
yorker length, well dug out down the ground for a single
slower ball, overpitches the would-be yorker and that's a shin-high full toss. They're not easy to deal with, of course, and that was driven to mid-on
bouncer, and that's called wide - a touch harsh, maybe
up there again and that's driven to the man at long-off
driven to the covers
Powell comes down the track and nearly gets himself stumped off a wide. What a fate that would have been.
backs away, backs away, and Smith follows him, sending it down leg, it's played back out to the covers.
driven to long-off and that's a single. He just stood there, expecting a boundary and missed out - he could have come back for two. Will he be kicking himself shortly?
prods and runs, giving him the strike back.
driven out to long-off and they stay for the single. Ah, so near...
he bashes that one straight, down on one knee, and finishes yet another match with a six.
